H0.text: Rubber is durable, which makes rubber basketballs better than leather basketballs for use on many different surfaces, whereas leather basketballs are made for indoor use on smooth surfaces.

H1.text: Rubber is lightweight, a property that makes rubber basketballs better suited for use on many different surfaces than leather basketballs, which are designed for indoor use on smooth surfaces.

H2.text: Rubber is dark in color, which makes it better than leather for use on many different surfaces, because leather basketballs are made for indoor use on smooth surfaces.

H3.text: Rubber is quickly produced, making rubber basketballs better than leather basketballs for use on many different surfaces.

A4.text: Resistance to abrasion makes softer kinds of rubber valuable for the treads of vehicle tires and conveyor belts, and makes hard rubber valuable for pump housings and piping used in the handling of abrasive sludge.

A5.text: The economic life of rubber trees in plantations is around 32 years, with up to 7 years being an immature phase and about 25 years of productive phase.
